Cross a small stream.
Cross a small stream.
Cross a small stream.
Cross a small stream.
Dawn. Ford the Snowbourne. Turn left on the road to Edoras.
Climb to Meduseld. Nazgûl flies over. Pippin sleeps during the day (Mar. 6). Gandalf begins organizing the Muster of Rohan.
Dusk. Return to the road. Ride east at great speed.
The road curves easterly around the mountain spur behind Edoras.
The Snowbourne meanders through willow trees left of the road.
The road curves southeast, hugging the eastern foothills of Irensaga.
Hills draw away to the south. Road continues through willows.
Scattered trees broaden into a wide willow thicket where the Snowbourne meets the Entwash.
Willow woods end. Road turns more south, parallels the Entwash.

Reach the area called the ‘Folde’, tucked against the hills, sheltered from the west and the south. A snowcapped peak rises on the south. North across the river the wide grassy Plains of Rohan are moonlit.
Road turns more to the east. Brief stop. Eat.
Cross a small stream.
Cross a small stream.
North of the road, the Entwash, flowing more slowly in the level plains is choked with vegetation and splits into multiple braided channels.
Cross a small stream. Enter the area called the ‘Fenmarch’ – a wetter area, especially north of the road where the Entwash becomes sluggish and starts to expand outward into a delta.
Cross a small stream.
South of the road great oak trees begin to appear – outliers of Firien Wood. Camp during day (Mar. 7).
Leave at dusk.
Northeast across the plain (80 miles away) the East Wall of Rohan and the Western Emyn Muil could be seen if it were daylight.
Cross the Mering Stream: Gondor. Enter the heart of the Firien Wood.
The Beacon of Halifirien lies right of the road on a hill which rises above the trees.
Leave Firien Wood.

Cross a small stream. The Beacons are Lit: far to the east Pippin spots the beacon of Amon Dîn as it is lit. Almost immediately the beacon fires to the west are ignited. Gandalf explains the beacons to Pippin.
The snowcapped peak above Calenhad rises to the right, lit by the nearly full moon.
The beacon tower of Calenhad stands on a foothill of Canlenhad peak. The beacon fires are now extinguished. Brief stop. Eat.
Cross a small stream.
Cross a small stream. The beacon hill of Minrimmon is on the right.
To the north the delta of the Entwash has broadened to over 50 miles. Rauros lies beyond, 100 miles away. Setting moon lights mists over the fens.
High above to the south rise the sawtoothed tips of Rimmon – the highest peak in the eastern White Mountains.
Dawn. Camp near the beacon hill of Erelas (day of Mar. 8).
Leave at dusk.
Cross a small stream.
Pass the beacon on Nardol, the ‘Fire Hill.’
Cross a small stream – the last which empties into the delta of the Entwash. West edge of Drúadan Forest south of the road.
Eilenach beacon stands on a steep hill to the south, rising above the trees of Drúadan Forest.
Brief stop. Eat.
Road curves slightly to the south. Due east across the Anduin the peaks of the Ephel Dùath stand dark against the moonlit sky.
The beacon hill Amon Dîn is 5 miles due south.
Road curves still more south around Amon Dîn.
Road runs SE. The thickets of the Grey Wood begin right of the road.
The Morgul Vale lies 35 miles due east.
The Grey Wood ends.
Mt. Mindolluin is visible to the southwest, lit by the predawn glow.
Dawn. Gandalf is challenged by the guards at the gate of the Rammas Echor: the wall surrounding the Pelennor Fields. Repairs are underway.
Reach the Gates of Minas Tirith.
Ride to 6th level, then climb to the Citadel (1.6 mi.). Talk with Denethor.
Pippin’s travels around the city.

name: Isengard to Minas Tirith (Aragorn)
description: Aragorn travels to Minas Tirith via the Paths of the Dead.

legs.comment: Isengard. Confrontation with Saruman. Gandalf breaks Saruman’s staff. Grima Wormtongue casts down the palantír of Orthanc. Pippin retrieves it, but Gandalf quickly takes it. Leave Isengard (ca. 4 p.m.)
Pass through the gates of Isengard. Follow the stone-paved road south.
Flooded spots gradually are disappearing.
Pass the pillar of the White Hand. Ents have broken the hand apart.
Stone pavement ends. Highway continues.
Night falls. Waxing moon rises.
All around are tree stumps, weeds and thorns.
Leave the Wizard’s Vale. Highway goes SSE toward the Fords.
Reach the campsite of the night before. Turn west.

Camp (ca. 10 p.m.). In a dale next to the south-facing slope of Dol Baran, the last hill of the northern ranges. Heather and bracken fern are turning green. While Gandalf sleeps, Pippin takes the palantír and is seen by Sauron. Gandalf prepares to ride out at once with Pippin. When a Nazgûl rides over, he warns Théoden not to wait for dawn to leave.
Aragorn and Merry, Legolas and Gimli ride out with Théoden, Éomer and 20 Riders (ca. midnight).
Return to the highway and turn south.
Company crosses the Fords of Isen.

They are overtaken by the Grey Company: Halbarad Dúnadan and 30 rangers of the North (summoned by Galadriel), plus Elrond’s sons: Elladan and Elrohir. Moon is westering, but shines out through clouds.
Reach the road to the Deeping Coomb and turn south to Helm’s Deep.
Climb upward through the Coomb.
Pass through Helm’s Dike.

Reach Helm’s Deep (ca. 6 a.m.). Enter the Hornburg. REST. Late morning Legolas and Gimli show Merry around the Deep. They lunch with Théoden and Riders. Aragorn confronts Sauron in the palantír and learns of the Black Fleet of Umbar. After consulting with Théoden, he decides to take the open road and ride for the Paths of the Dead. Merry rides with Rohirrim (1 p.m.). Aragorn eats, then departs (1:30 p.m.).
Pass through Helm’s Dike. Ride swiftly down the Deeping Coomb.
Reach the beaten road from the Ford of Isen and turn east to Edoras.
Cross a small stream. Dusk.
Cross a small stream.
Cross a small stream. Camp (ca. 9:30 p.m.).
Leave at dawn.
Cross a small stream.
Cross a small stream.
Cross a small stream.
Cross a small stream. Brief stop. Eat.
Ford the Snowbourne. Turn left on the road to Edoras.
Climb to Meduseld in Edoras. Brief stop.
Return to the Ford. Turn south into Harrowdale.
Hamlet of Upbourn.
Hamlet of Underharrow. Peaks of Irensaga are high above.
Opposite the waterfalls from the western ravine.
Reach the trail from the western ravine. Road turns east to the Hold.
Climb the switchback road ‘Stair of the Hold’ some hundreds of feet up the mountain face. Ancient statues mark each turn of the road: the Púkel-men. A last cutting climbs a short slope. Dusk.
Reach the Firienfeld of Dunharrow. Aragorn tells Éowyn of his plans.
Aragorn and company head east to the Dwimorberg, following the path lined with standing stones (ca. 6 a.m.).
They pass into the gloom of the dark woods of the Dimholt. See a last mighty standing stone. Horses refuse to pass and must be led.
They pass the Dark Door into the Haunted Mountain, still leading the horses: the Paths of the Dead.
In a cavern they see Baldor’s skeleton by a closed stone door. Aragorn summons the Dead. The torches are blown out.
Gimli is the last of the Living. He goes in fear. The Dead follow.
Gimli stumbles and falls. Crawls.
The sound of water begins to be heard – the springs of the River Morthond: the Blackroot.
Exit the Paths of the Dead through a high-arched broad opening. Remount horses (ca. 4 p.m.).
A steep road descends through the deep ravine. The river is on the left.
Evening falls.
Ravine ends like “a crack in a wall.” The river pours over many falls. Reach the wide Morthond Vale (ca. 7 p.m.). See lights in houses below.
Cross a bridge over the torrent and follow a road east into the Vale.
As reach houses, all lights are put out. Bells are ringing in warning.
River turns southwest, further away from the road.
Reach the foot of the Hill of Erech.

Aragorn climbs to the Stone of Erech. Arrives just before midnight. The stone is a great globe half buried in the ground, but the height of a man. Aragorn’s great banner is unfurled and he speaks with the Dead. Camp.
Dawn. Ride from Erech in great haste, southeast down the road.
Pass through the most northeasterly lands of Morthond – home of 500 bowmen who have gone to Minas Tirith with Duinhir and his sons.
Road runs between hills on both sides: Tarlang’s Neck.
Enter Lamedon – home of a few grim hillmen who have gone to Minas Tirith without a captain. As they reach the uplands, the Dead sweep past, but Aragorn orders them back. Stop to eat: Noon.
Road drops slowly into the lowlands.
The road continues to curve through a lowland between the Hills of Tarlang on the west and an outlying spur of the White Mountains on the north.
Hills of Tarlang curve east and thrust closer to the road.
To the east the River Ciril meanders through the meads.
Dusk. Eat, then ride on.
The Hills of Tarlang end and the vale of the River Ringló opens to the southwest. The Hills of Tarnost rise ahead in the southeast.
The road turns more east toward the River Ciril.
The fords of Ciril. A red sunset can be seen far in the west lighting the tops of the Pinnath Gelin (Green Hills).
Camp just past the ford (ca. 9:30 p.m.). Farms of the Township of Calembel are deserted – many gone to war; the rest, fled.
No dawn. Leave when gloom first lightens.
Pass the village of Calembel.
Towering hills rise on the north. To the south the Ciril joins the Ringló.
A valley opens on the north stretching to the foot of Halifirien mount.
A great southern spur of the White Mountains rises just ten miles north. To the south are the Hills of Tarnost.
Noon.
They ford the Ringló at Ethring. Stop briefly to eat.
Road rises slightly and curves due south as it is barred on the east by a great arm of the mountains, jutting down from the mount of Rimmon.
Road climbs a slope at the very end of the mountain arm.
Beyond the rise of the crest, they descend into some of the richest lands thus far: Dor-en-Ernil (Land of the Prince) – the most eastern lands under Prince Imrahil.
Past dusk. Camp in the midst of the open valley.
No dawn. Leave at first light.
The lands open out, almost flat all the way to the Great River Anduin.
Noon. Eat.
They drop into coastal lowlands as they near the estuary of the Gilrain.
A low terrace appears east of the road, damming a small lake above.
Reach the outskirts of the town of Linhir.

At the fords where the Gilrain and the Serni join, they find Men of Lamedon fighting off ships of Umbar and Harad (ca. 3:30 p.m.). All flee from the Dead except Angbor of Lamedon, whom Aragorn bids follow.
Camp east of the fords.
No dawn. Road now curves east. The terrace face rises on the north as the company rides forth.
The River Serni cuts through the terrace face and flows west.
All this area is already contested. The enemy flies east before them.
Road swings more to the northeast.
The fabled ‘green fields of Lebennin’ appear grey and trampled.
Road parallels the course of the Anduin, 15 miles away.
Camp again.
Leave at first light.
Road begins to swing toward the Great River.
The enemy are still being driven ahead, but are getting desperate as they near the river.
Cross the River Sirith. Reach the Pelargir. Legolas hears the cries of gulls.

Noon. At the Havens of Pelargir is the Fleet of Umbar: 50 great ships and numerous smaller vessels. The Haradrim turn to fight. Aragorn calls forth the Dead. The Battle of Pelargir. The mariners cast themselves overboard in fear. Aragorn drives through the enemies on shore. The Dead depart after Aragorn declares their oaths fulfilled. Freed captives and the host from that part of Gondor gather and prepare the ships.
Fleet goes north at first light. No wind. Row against the current.
Pass between the fields of Lebennin on the west and South Ithilien on east.
Legolas senses the change in the wind.
Night falls. Due north a red glow can be seen under the cloud – Minas Tirith is burning.
River Erui enters on the west.
Midnight. Continue upriver. Sea-crafty men sense wind from the sea.
Hoist sail. Speed grows.
River curves west toward Minas Tirith.
The lands of Lossarnach are on the west. Many folk live there under the kindly rule of Furlong the Fat.
Dawn. Clouds lighten.
The southern slopes of the Emyn Arnen appear on the eastern shore.
River swings northeast as it rounds the ‘knee’ of the Emyn Arnen.

The Battle of the Pelennor Fields has been raging since dawn and Éomer sees the black ships arriving at Harlond: the havens southeast of the city (9 a.m.). On the lead ship Aragorn’s banner is unfurled: the White Tree, seven stars, and golden crown – signs of Elendil. Aragorn leads his forces onto the field of battle. Winds blow away the darkness.
Aragorn and Éomer meet in the midst of battle.
Continue the struggle throughout the day.
Aragorn reaches the Gates of Minas Tirith at dusk with Éomer and Imrahil. He bids his tents be raised on the field outside the Gates.
Aragorn climbs to the Houses of Healing, heals Faramir, Éowyn, Merry, many others – then returns to his tents (3.1 mi. to/from Gates).

name: Isengard to Minas Tirith (Merry)
description: Merry follows the Rohirrim to Minas Tirith.

legs.comment: Isengard. Confrontation with Saruman. Gandalf breaks Saruman’s staff. Grima Wormtongue casts down the palantír of Orthanc. Pippin retrieves it, but Gandalf quickly takes it. Leave Isengard (ca. 4 p.m.)
Pass through the gates of Isengard. Follow the stone-paved road south.
Flooded spots gradually are disappearing.
Pass the pillar of the White Hand. Ents have broken the hand apart.
Stone pavement ends. Highway continues.
Night falls. Waxing moon rises.
All around are tree stumps, weeds and thorns.
Leave the Wizard’s Vale. Highway goes SSE toward the Fords.
Reach the campsite of the night before. Turn west.

Camp (ca. 10 p.m.). In a dale next to the south-facing slope of Dol Baran, the last hill of the northern ranges. Heather and bracken fern are turning green. While Gandalf sleeps, Pippin takes the palantír and is seen by Sauron. Gandalf plans to ride out at once with Pippin. When a Nazgûl rides over, he warns Théoden not to wait for the dawn to leave.
Aragorn and Merry, Legolas and Gimli ride out with Théoden, Éomer and 20 Riders (ca. midnight).
Return to the highway and turn south.
Company crosses the Fords of Isen.

They are overtaken by the Grey Company: Halbarad Dúnadan and 30 rangers of the North (summoned by Galadriel), plus Elrond’s sons: Elladan and Elrohir. Moon is westering, but shines out through clouds.
Reach the road to the Deeping Coomb and turn south to Helm’s Deep.
Climb upward through the Coomb.
Pass through Helm’s Dike.

Reach Helm’s Deep (ca. 6 a.m.). Enter the Hornburg. REST. Late morning Legolas and Gimli show Merry around the Deep. Lunch with Théoden and Riders. Aragorn confronts Sauron in the palantír and learns of the Black Fleet of Umbar. After consulting with Théoden, he decides to take the open road and ride for the Paths of the Dead. Merry rides out with Rohirrim (1 p.m.).
Riders pass through Helm’s Dike. Aragorn, Legolas and Gimli watch.
Ride down through the Deeping Coomb.
Turn east on a path that skirts the foothills.
Path turns south among the hills.
Reach crest of a ridge.
Valley.
Ridge. Far above rise some of the highest peaks of the White Mountains.
Reach a small stream. Turn north. Merry rides with Théoden.
Cross stream. Continue east.
Camp by a stream in a shallow valley.
Leave just after dawn. Cross stream and climb hill.
Reach hillcrest. Turn SW along the crest.
Leave hillcrest and descend hillslope.
Reach a small stream. Turn north. Merry rides with Théoden.
Cross stream. Continue east.
Ridge. Turn south, climbing onto higher mountainsides now.
Cross a small stream. Brief stop. Eat.
Climb a still higher ridge. Reach crest. Turn south along crest.
Descend steep hillside from the crest. Zig-zag path.
Reach stream. Cross stream and turn north. Merry rides with Théoden.
Turn east from valley. Angle ENE up a high mountain ridge.
Reach crest.
Angle south down steep slope.
Dusk. Reach valley. Camp by small stream. Snow on peak above camp.
Leave just after dawn. Cross stream and climb a slight rise.
Reach a swift-flowing mountain stream. Turn NE beside it. Merry rides with Théoden.
Cross stream. Continue alongside it. Merry rides with Théoden.
Turn east from stream. Climb a steep mountainside. Trees more scarce.
Reach the highest crest thus far. No trees. Merry rides with Théoden.
Snake down steep slope, pitted by bowl-shaped hollows: old cirques. Eat.
Cross a rushing stream just below where three mountain rills join, cascading down from glaciers above on the mountain peak.
Zig-zag up an open mountainside to a steep-cut ridge crest.
CAMP on the crest of the High Pass. COLD. No water source.
Angle SE down the steep-falling slope of the ridge.
Reach a small stream tumbling down from the peak. Follow valley east. Pines begin to appear.
A second stream joins the first. Valley deepens and has pine-clad walls. Eat.
Cross the upland stream and follow the right bank.
The stream begins to cut a ravine on the left. In places the path climbs away along the valleyside.

Reach the valley mouth above Harrowdale. Valley is already in shadow and one light shines out. Stream plunges down a waterfall. Path turns SE from the western ravine and descends the steepsided wall of the valley. Fir-woods cloak the valley walls. Starkhorn looms over them on the south, its peak shining red in the sunset (ca. 5:30 p.m.).

Ford the Snowbourne. Cross to the valley floor and reach the road from Edoras. Most riders camp in the valley, joining the thousands already waiting there. Théoden’s company continues east to the Hold.
They climb the switchback road ‘Stair of the Hold’ some hundreds of feet up the mountain face. Ancient statues mark each turn of the road: the Púkel-men. A last cutting climbs a short slope.

Reach the Firienfeld of Dunharrow. Éowyn greets them there. Camp. Theoden’s Pavilion is set north of the standing stone-lined path. Merry has a small tent nearby. As Merry and others eat with the king, a errand-rider of Gondor arrives with ‘The Red Arrow’ – a plea to come to the aid of Minas Tirith.
The dark has already reached Dunharrow when Merry is awakened in the morning (ca. 7 a.m.). Éowyn arms Merry. Théoden’s company leaves the Hold (ca. 9 a.m.). Merry rides Stybba.
Ride down the ‘Stair of the Hold’ and reach the valley.
Road turns north to Edoras. Théoden’s company is joined by 5500 riders fully armed, and many hundreds of other men with horses. Merry notices Dernhelm among the host.
Opposite the waterfalls from the western ravine.
Hamlet of Underharrow. Peaks of Irensaga are high above.
Hamlet of Upbourn.

Leave Harrowdale. Reach the road from the ford of the Snowbourne. Noon. Halt a short while on the road below Edoras. Eat. The Muster of Rohan – 60 more riders arrive, making the muster complete: “6000 spears to Sunlending.” Théoden refuses for Merry to ride with the Rohirrim. Éowyn (disguised as Dernhelm) takes Merry in secret.
The road curves easterly around the mountain spur behind Edoras.
The Snowbourne meanders through willow trees left of the road.
The road curves southeast, hugging the eastern foothills of Irensaga.
Hills draw away to the south. Road continues through willows.
Scattered trees broaden into a wide willow thicket where the Snowbourne meets the Entwash.
Camp in the Willow thicket (ca. 7 p.m.).
Leave at first ‘light’ in the gray gloom.
Willow woods end. Road turns more south, parallels the Entwash.

Reach the area called the ‘Folde’, tucked against the hills, sheltered from the west and the south. A snowcapped peak rises on the south. North across the river the wide grassy Plains of Rohan can be seen.
Road turns more to the east.
Cross a small stream.
Cross a small stream. Brief stop to eat.
30 miles north of the road the Entwash, flowing more slowly in the level plains, is choked with vegetation and splits into multiple braided channels.
Cross a small stream. Enter the area called the ‘Fenmarch’ – a wetter area, especially north of the road where the Entwash becomes sluggish and starts to expand outward into a delta.
Dusk. Cross a small stream. Camp.
Leave at first light. Still dark and gloomy.
South of the road great oak trees begin to appear – outliers of Firien Wood. On the north mists rise above the fens of the Entwash.
Lone man, fleeing west, tells of war on the plains and the Wold.
Northeast across the plain (80 miles away) the East Wall of Rohan and the Western Emyn Muil could be seen if it were clear.
Cross the Mering Stream: Gondor. Enter the heart of the Firien Wood.
The beacon of Halifirien lies right of the road on a hill which rises above the trees. Its fires are now extinguished.
Leave Firien Wood.
Cross a small stream. Brief stop to eat.
The snowcapped peak above Calenhad rises to the right.
The beacon tower of Calenhad stands on a foothill of Calenhad peak.
Cross a small stream. Camp.
Leave at first light.
Cross a small stream. The beacon hill of Minrimmon is on the right.
To the north the delta of the Entwash has broadened to over 50 miles. Rauros lies beyond, 100 miles due north of the road.
High above to the south rise the sawtoothed tips of Rimmon – the highest peak in the eastern White Mountains.
Pass the beacon hill of Erelas. Brief pause to eat.
Cross a small stream.
Pass the beacon on Nardol, the ‘Fire Hill.’
Cross a small stream – the last which empties into the delta of the Entwash. West edge of Druadan Forest south of the road.
Turn south into Druadan Forest to camp out of sight of the road. Scouts report that trenches and stakes block the road 6 miles east.
Camp in the pine-woods near the hill of Eilenach Beacon.

Late in the night Merry is wakeful and hears drums. Follows Elfhelm to Théoden. Ghân-buri-Ghân, chief of the Wild Men, offers to guide the Riders through a hidden way. They depart as quickly as possible.
The passage south through the woods is slow and pathless.
kirt the western foot of the hill of Eilenach.

Reach the west end of Stonewain Valley: the remains of a vast quarry, mined into both sides of an east-running valley. Though overgrown, the road still allows four horses to ride abreast. Move more quickly.
The valley road descends from west to east. Light more dim than ever.
East end of Stonewain Valley. Road continues through trees.
Northeast through openings they can see the beacon hill of Amon Dîn.
Mindolluin rises to the south. Thickets of the Grey Wood hide road.
Camp (ca. 4:30 p.m.) in the heart of the Grey Wood. Scouts report.
Riders move east toward the main road during the night (ca. 3 a.m.).
Reach the east edge of the Grey Wood.
Meet the Great West Road. Turn toward the city. Ride quickly.
Road turns more south nearing the skirts of Mt. Mindolluin. See a red glow on clouds ahead: fires of Minas Tirith.
Riders spread out on each side of the road. Ride very fast.
Théoden briefs his three captains and calls out to encourage his Riders.
Dawn (above the reek). Reach the Rammas Echor: the outwalls of the Pelennor Fields. The enemy has thrown down the walls and the Riders pass through the breaches, killing the few orcs.
Théoden leads the Riders slightly to the east, moving quietly.

Stop. Can smell the burning of the city. Merry feels a south wind and can see the clouds breaking far in the south. They see the flash and hear the BOOM from the breaking of the Gates. Théoden cries out to the Rohirrim and blows a great blast on a horn: “Great horns of the North, wildly blowing. Rohan had come at last.” Riders surge forth, with Théoden in the center. The Battle of the Pelennor Fields.
Théoden is crushed, pinned beneath his steed when the Lord of the Nazgul descends. Éowyn (aided by Merry) slays the Witch King. Éowyn falls.
Merry follows the litter bearers into the city of Minas Tirith.
Pippin finds Merry wandering lost in a lane part way up the hill. Gandalf carries him to the Houses of Healing (1.5 miles).
Continue to fight with the Rohirrim during the struggle which lasts throughout the day.

name: Minas Tirith to Morannon
description: Everybody comes together for the last stand against Mordor.

legs.comment: Go with the Scouts to/from the Cross-roads
Host assembles before Gates of Minas Tirith. Go ENE through the Pelennor.
Pass between Causeway Forts on the Rammas Echor. Follow Causeway east across the flatlands of the Anduin valley.
Reach the western walls of Osgiliath. Pass through “ruins of Old Gondor.”
Use ferries and boat-bridges of the enemy to cross the Anduin.
Continue through ruins of east Osgiliath. Pass new defense works.
Infantry halts 5 miles east of the Anduin. Camps by the River Morgul.
Horsemen continue up the Morgul-road east. It is straight, but climbing.
Reach the Cross-roads by evening. Heralds proclaim the coming of the Lords of Gondor. No other sounds. Repair statue of the King. Camp.
Gandalf, Aragorn and vanguard ride to Minas Morgul. Destroy bridge, then return. Remainder of Host reaches Cross-roads. All camp.
Leave a strong guard at Cross-roads: archers of Ithilien. Rest of Host moves north on the road. Send scouts ahead and on each side.
Heralds proclaim the coming of the Lords of Gondor. Prince Imrahil suggests they say “King Elessar.” Weather fair, with west wind.
Dark thickets rise from the tumbled land below the Ephel Dúath.
Cross stream on a masonry bridge. Heralds proclaim the coming of King Elessar. Rest.
Cross stream on bridge. Rest.
Heralds proclaim the coming of King Elessar. Camp by stream.
Cross stream on bridge. Continue north on road.
Heralds proclaim the coming of King Elessar. Cross stream on bridge.
Heralds proclaim the coming of King Elessar. Weather still fair.
Reach south end of long cut through out-thrust arm of the mountains.
Heralds proclaim the coming of King Elessar.
Host is attacked by Orcs and Easterlings (same place as Faramir had defeated the Haradrim). Well warned by scouts, they easily defeat the attack. Camp there by stream. Nazgûl overfly camp.
Cross stream on bridge. Nazgûl continue to overfly.
Heralds proclaim the coming of King Elessar. Cross stream on bridge.
Heralds proclaim the coming of King Elessar.
Cross stream on bridge.
Heralds proclaim the coming of King Elessar.
Reach the point where the road turns northeast toward the Black Gate. Camp west of road, next to a stream.
Swing northwest away from the road.
Follow a dry stream-bed leading toward the Wetwang.
Turn northeast, roughly paralleling the road.
Rest. Reach the desert-like lands west of Mordor. See the beginnings of the       Desolation of the Morannon. Aragorn dismisses the faint-hearted.
Eat. Continue on, slowly.
Camp.
Continue northeast.
Pass among the moors of the Noman-lands. Draw together. No scouts.
Eat. Rest. Continue on very slowly. Expect attack, but none comes.
Camp northwest of the Black Gates. All are wakeful. Sense that things prowl around them. No wind. Cold.
Dawn. North wind rises. Turn southeast toward the Morannon.
Pass among slag heaps and noisome pits.
Early day: reach the Black Gate. Aragorn arrays Host on two hills of stone. Parley with the Mouth of Sauron. The Battle of Morannon. Barad-dûr and the Morannon collapse when the Ring is destroyed.

name: Morannon to Minas Tirith
description: The triumphant return to Minas Tirith.

legs.comment: Wounded are placed on supply-wains. Move slowly to protect the wounded. Begin trek down the Southward Road, away from the rubble of the Morannon. Scouts follow retreating enemies to assure they do not return.
Ride southwest. Road runs in a trenchlike valley between the mountains and the moors. It is newly repaired for many miles.
End of the slag heaps.
Stop for the night. Camp along the road.
Start ca. 8 a.m. Continue down the road.
Road turns more to the south.
Reach northern edge of Ithilien. East across road are dark trees. Closer ‘a tumbled heathland’ with ‘knots of pine-trees.’ Air is fresh and fragrant.
Road is straight and level. Go more quickly.
In valley between mountains on east and steep slopes on west.
Woods appear to the west. Some growth begins along the road edges.
Road crosses stream on an arched masonry bridge.
Road becomes more overgrown. Camp along the road.
Start ca. 8 a.m. Continue on Southward Road.
Another stream is bridged.
Reach north end of a long straight cutting through a stony ridge.

Turn off the road. Climb west bank and go downhill. Many wounded now can walk. Some ride horses. Others are carried on litters. Many troops continue south on the road for return directly to Minas Tirith.
Follow the nearby stream to the small clear pool visited 3 weeks before by Frodo and Sam. Troops find and cleanse nearby orc fire-ring.
Troops stay north of stream. Descend steep slope.
Thread their way through woodland, north of the stream channel.
Trees grow thinner. The stream now runs “in a narrow gorge.”
Camp near Henneth Annûn. Some go to the caves for supplies.
Continue downhill through woodland. Must skirt widely around the hollow of the waterfall.
Return to the stream. It still falls swiftly.
Slope is more gentle. Trees begin to open out. The Anduin can be seen.
Another stream joins on the southern shore.
Reach the open, grassy flatlands by the Anduin: the Field of Cormallen.
Set up camp with numerous pavilions.
Wander in Ithilien, revisiting places Frodo and Sam had seen earlier.
Leave early. The Host goes south, taking boats down the Anduin.
The south end of Cair Andros lies on the west, stream mouth on east.
Stream enters on east.
Can see Amon Dîn due west.
Stream enters on east.
Reach northern edge of Osgiliath. Continue down river to landings.
Reach landings of Osgiliath. Dock and unload wounded.
Mid-morning. Leave Osgiliath and go west along the Causeway.
Reach the Causeway Forts on the Rammas Echor.
Continue on the road across the Pelennor.
Reach the Gates of Minas Tirith. Aragorn camps in the field.

name: Minas Tirith to Isengard
description: The Fellowship leaves Minas Tirith, following the same roads for at least a while.

legs.comment: Kings Aragorn and Éomer escort the funeral bier of King Théoden from The Hallows, where he has lain in one of the tombs along Rath Dínen, the Silent Street. Proceed up Fen Hollin to the Sixth Circle, then down through the City. A great host watches the procession in silence. When they reach the Gates, the bier is placed on a great wain.

Noon – Depart from the Gates of Minas Tirith. Merry rides on the wain, guarding the King’s arms. With them go all who remain of the Fellowship, as well as Queen Arwen, Elrond and his sons, Celeborn and Galadriel, and many knights of Gondor and Rohan.
Process through the Pelennor. Stop for the night at the gate of the Rammas Echor: the wall surrounding the Pelennor Fields.
Mt. Mindolluin is visible to the southwest, lit by the predawn glow.
The Grey Wood begins.
The Morgul Vale lies 35 miles due east.
Camp.

Thickets of the Grey Wood lie left of the road with Amon Dîn rising to the west of the Wood. Drums can be heard in the distance. King Aragorn’s heralds announce that the Forest of Drúadan is given to Ghân-buri-ghân and his folk and none may enter it without their leave.
Road curves more to the west around Amon Dîn.
The beacon hill Amon Dîn is 5 miles due south.
Camp by road north of the Drúadan Forest.
Road curves slightly to the north. Due east across the Anduin the peaks of the Ephel Dùath can be seen dark against the climbing sun.
Camp.
Eilenach beacon stands on a steep hill to the south, rising above the trees of Drúadan Forest.
Cross a small stream – the most eastern which empties into the delta of the Entwash. Along the Anduin the delta extends over 100 miles. The west edge of Drúadan Forest south of the road. Camp.
Pass the beacon on Nardol, the ‘Fire Hill.’
Cross a small stream.
Camp.
The beacon hill of Erelas stands south of the road.
Camp.
High above to the south rise the sawtoothed tips of Rimmon – the highest peak in the eastern White Mountains: still snowcapped.
To the north the delta of the Entwash still stretches over 50 miles north to south. Rauros lies beyond, 100 miles away.
Camp.
Cross a small stream. The beacon hill of Minrimmon is on the left.
Cross a small stream.
Camp.
The beacon tower of Calenhad stands on a foothill of Calenhad peak.
Camp.
The peak above Calenhad rises to the left – still streaked with snow.
Cross a small stream.
Reach the edge of Firien Wood.
Camp in Firien Wood.
The Beacon of Halifirien lies left of the road on a hill which rises above the trees.

Cross the Mering Stream: Rohan. Enter the heart of the Firien Wood. This is the area called the ‘Fenmarch’ – a wet area, especially north of the road where the Entwash becomes sluggish and starts its spread outward into a delta.
Northeast across the plain (80 miles away) the East Wall of Rohan and the Western Emyn Muil can be seen.
Camp. Still among the trees.
South of the road the last of the great oak trees stand – end of Firien Wood.
Cross a small stream.
Camp.
Cross a small stream. The Fenmarch ends. Enter the area called the ‘Folde’, tucked against the hills, sheltered from the west and the south.
North of the road, the Entwash, flowing slowly in the level plains is choked with vegetation and is split into multiple braided channels.
Camp.

legs.day_full:
21 miles
Note: Although ‘Many Partings’ (LOTR:RK) states that the journey took 15 days, this conflicts with the specific dates given in‘The Tale of Years’. The latter reference is used here.
legs.comment: Cross a small stream. North across the Entwash the wide grassy Plains of Rohan lie green in the sun.

legs.day_full:
21 miles
Note: Although ‘Many Partings’ (LOTR:RK) states that the journey took 15 days, this conflicts with the specific dates given in‘The Tale of Years’. The latter reference is used here.
legs.comment: Cross a small stream. Camp.
Road turns more to the west.
Leave the Folde. A peak rises on the south – no longer snowcapped.
Camp.
Willow woods appear. Road turns more north, parallels the Entwash.
A wide willow thicket grows where the Snowbourne meets the Entwash, but narrows to scattered trees beside the road.
Camp.
Hills draw away to the south. Road continues through scattered willows.
The road curves northwest, hugging the foothills of Irensaga.
Camp.
The Snowbourne meanders through willow trees right of the road.
The road curves westerly around the mountain spur east of Edoras.
Reach field below the barrow mounds.
Climb to Meduseld in Edoras.
Leave Edoras. Turn west on the road to Helm’s Deep.
Ford the Snowbourne.
Cross a small stream.
Cross a small stream.
Cross a small stream. Camp.
Cross a small stream.
Cross a small stream.
Camp.
Cross a small stream.
Cross a small stream.
Camp.
Reach the road to the Deeping Coomb and Helm’s Deep. Turn south.
Climb upward through the Coomb.
Pass through Helm’s Dike.
Reach Helm’s Deep. Enter the Hornburg.
Leave Helm’s Deep.
Pass through Helm’s Dike. Ride down the Deeping Coomb.
Reach the beaten road and turn west to the Fords of Isen.
The peaks of the Thrihyrne rise to the south.
Cross the Fords of Isen. Pass the burial mound of Erkenbrand’s Riders.
Turn north on the highway to Isengard.
Camp 15 miles north of the Fords – the same campsite as March 4.
Enter the south end of the Wizard’s Vale.
All around are newly planted trees and shrubs.
Highway becomes a wide street, paved with stones.
The rubble from pillar of the White Hand now surrounds a sapling.
All is green and growing.
Reach the circle of Isengard, but the stone-circle is gone. A tall tree stands on each side of the old gateway, with a green path to Orthanc.

Saruman’s Isengard is no more. The Ents have transformed it into the Treegarth of Orthanc. The Tower rises from a mirroring lake, with an east-running stream feeding the Isen. All the circle is filled with trees and orchards. Treebeard tells Gandalf of Saruman’s release. Legolas and Gimli say farewell, and turn east to go home via Fangorn Forest.

Saruman’s Isengard is no more. The Ents have transformed it into the Treegarth of Orthanc. The Tower rises from a mirroring lake, with an east-running stream feeding the Isen. All the circle is filled with trees and orchards. Treebeard tells Gandalf of Saruman’s release. Legolas and Gimli say farewell, and turn east to go home via Fangorn Forest.
Pass from the circle of Isengard. Follow the stone-paved road south.
All is green and growing.
Pass the sapling at the old pillar of the White Hand.
Stone pavement ends. Highway continues.
All around are newly planted trees and shrubs.
Leave the Wizard’s Vale.
Reach the campsite of the night before. Sunset. Final Separation: Aragorn and his knights ride on toward the Fords. Travellers turn west.
Camp in the dell next to the south-facing slope of Dol Baran, the last hill of the northern ranges. Here Pippin looked into the palantír.
Curve west from Dol Baran around the foothills of Methedras.
Camp. Still in the Gap of Rohan. White Mountains only ca. 50 miles south.
Continue west near foothills.
Turn slightly north. Open lands widen into wasted plains of Dunland.
Camp by a small stream.
Cross stream. Turn northwest.
Dunlendings see company and hide.
Camp at base of an out-thrust hill of Methedras.
Continue riding almost due north.
Cross a small stream.
Hills draw away to east. Wide plains lie west.
Reach the remains of the roadway to Tharbad. Camp.
Follow the old roadway northwest.
See woods in the distance across the roadway.
Snowcapped peak of Methedras rises due east.
Stop at a small stream. Woods lie to east and north. Camp.
Cross stream and enter the woods.
Woods extend further west, into a valley between two streams.
A root of Methedras reaches west toward the road.
Leave wood just before sunset. Overtake Saruman and Grima Wormtongue walking north also. Saruman turns west with Grima.
Company stops by a stream. Camp.
Cross stream. Enter Northern Dunland. Continue on roadway.
Empty land, though green and pleasant.
Camp.
Continue northwest on roadway.
Draw farther and farther from the mountains and foothills.
Camp.
Continue northwest on roadway.
Reach a point where the land drops into the valley of the Greyflood. Turn northeast from the roadway and follow the ridge of the upland shelf. Weather golden.
Camp in plains. Marshes of the Swanfleet lie to the north.
Continue northeast.
Continue to follow the eastern edge of the upland shelf.
Camp in plains. Silver night.
Continue northeast.
Can see mists above the fens of the Swanfleet delta.
Cross the ford of the Swanfleet. West of the ford are falls where the river descends from the upland shelf to the lowlands of the Greyflood, spreading in a broad inland delta.
Eregion – Turn east and follow the river.
Camp by river.
Continue east next to the river.
Reach the ruins of Ost-en-Edhil, the former chief city of the Elf-realm of Hollin/Eregion. Camp at the confluence of the Glanduin and the Sirannon.
Follow the Moria-road east on the north bank of the Sirannon.
Valley deepens. Road runs above the valleyway.
Camp.
Continue east on Moria-road. Mountains of Moria rise ahead of them.
Turn northeast from the road.
Reach the hill where the Fellowship had sheltered from the Warg attack. Camp.

Galadriel, Celeborn, and others from Lórien depart. Travel NE toward the Redhorn Gate. Others watch until see the flash of Galadriel’s ring. Gandalf and the hobbits start for Rivendell. Travel northwest from the hill.
Note: This journey takes only 9 days vs. 20 days for the Fellowship going south. The need for stealth can carry a high price, time-wise – and ponies go faster than hobbits!
Camp.

Continue northwest from the hill.
Note: This journey is about 25 - 30 miles west of the path taken by the Fellowship.
Open country. Gentle slopes, easier for the ponies.
Cross a small stream. Camp. Due east Caradhras glows in sunset.
Turn due north.
Reach the foot of Hollin Ridge. Begin to climb, angling west.
Camp atop Hollin Ridge among the large smooth towering rocks.
Start down the north side of the ridge. Thread their way between rocks.
Reach the base of the ridge. Turn northeast.
Cross a small stream.
Camp west of a hill.
Continue northeast.
Land becomes more rugged to the east.
Descend a slope to a small stream valley. Camp by stream.
Cross stream and ride east alongside it.
Climb out of stream valley. Continue northeast.
Reach crest of a hill. Start down at an angle.
Reach a small stream. Marshy area lies to the west. Camp.
Cross the stream and follow valley east-northeast.
Climb northeast up a slope. In the west, the marsh ends.
Turn north. Start downhill again.
Cross a small stream. Camp.

To the west the Loudwater/Bruinen now runs in a deep valley and the surrounding terrain is too rugged to cross easily. Turn northeast again. 
Note: Gradually they have returned to the path followed south by the Fellowship.
Cross a small stream.
Cross a small stream. Camp.
Turn slightly west of north.
Reach Ford of Bruinen. Follow stone-marked path NE to Rivendell.
Come to the valley of Rivendell and descend zig-zag road.
Reach the Last Homely House.

name: Rivendell to Bag End
description: The hobbits finally make it home.

legs.comment: Leave the Last Homely House – mid-morning. Cold.
Climb out of the valley of Rivendell. Ride slowly.
Camp northeast of the Ford of Bruinen.
Continue slowly.
Reach the Ford. Frodo hesitates to cross. He is in pain: anniversary of his wounding on Weathertop. Continue across the Ford.
Road climbs through a cutting of red stone topped with tall pines.
Road continues gently uphill. Much grass on sides. Hills on the north.
Camp south side of road.
Continue west-southwest along road, riding slowly. Frodo still ill.
Cross a small stream. Road bends more SW, skirting the feet of the Trollshaws. The steep ravine of the Bruinen also runs WSW not far S.
Eat. Frodo begins to feel better.
Camp near a valley from the north.
Leave after a leisurely breakfast.
Bruinen turns more to the south.
Eat. Rest. Can see ruins on hilltop to the north.
Camp near a valley from the north.
Road now runs due west.
Eat below out-thrust ‘toe’ of a hill.
Camp. Wander in autumn woods which run into the valley on the north.
Continue west on road through woods.
Leave woods.
Eat.
Camp. Still warm.
Road now turns northwest. Still skirts hills.
Reach pathway to Stone Trolls. Sam tells Frodo what happened there.
Ride north up the pathway to see the Stone Trolls. Camp there.
Return to the road.
Eat. Continue northwest on the road.
Road climbs over an out-thrust hill from north. Hills now also south of road with valleys running SW to Hoarwell.
Reach hillcrest. Can see Hoarwell below.
Ruins on hilltop north of road. Camp in a SW-running valley.
Road rounds ‘toe’ of a hill from the north: the end of the Trollshaws.
Pass point where Strider led them north from road (exactly 1 year ago).
Cross The Last Bridge. Road now turns more to the west. Eat.
Reach northeast end of valley which they had followed from Weathertop. They pass by and continue WNW on the road into the Lone-lands.
Weather still fair. Camp.
Road swings northwest through open country. South of the road are bushes and stunted trees: wild and pathless. Ride now more quickly.
Camp.
Road curves more to west. Open country. No streams
Camp..
Continue west. Far ahead begin to see tops of the Weather Hills.
Camp.
Continue west on road.
Weather hills slowly rise on the horizon.
Camp.
Continue west.
Road turns slightly to the south. Hills now are more prominent.
Camp.
Road now runs southwest. Weathertop becomes visible straight ahead.
Camp. Weather still is warm and clear.
Road continues southwest. Land rises slowly toward Hills.
Camp. Weathertop lies just south of due west.
Hurry along the road.
Pass the first foothills below Weathertop.
Road reaches southeastern foot of Weathertop. Eat in haste.
Weathertop immediately north of road. Frodo refuses to look at it. As the shadows lengthen, they continue hurriedly past.
Camp. Weather turns damp and cold.
Road continues south to swing south of the Midgewater Marshes.
Weather turns wet and cold.
Land now slopes slowly downhill, away from Weathertop.
Camp. Damp and cold.
Road continues southwest and slowly downhill.
Reach the southeast edge of the Midgewater Marshes.
Road curves west around southern edge of the Marshes.
Drizzly all day. Ride a bit more quickly.
Camp due south of the Marshes.
Road curves slightly north of west. Marshes fill all the northern horizon.
Camp. Marshes farther north from the road.
Road continues west-northwest.
Can see western edge of the Marshes through the misty rain.
Still drizzly. Camp.
Road continues west-northwest. Rises slightly uphill.
Begin to see the Chetwood in distance ahead. Dark through the rain.
Rain becomes heavy. West wind. Reach the south edge of the Chetwood. Trees nearly barren.

Camp in stables of The Forsaken Inn: inn now closed. Rains all night.
Note: Bilbo stayed at the inn nearly 80 years before.
Continue NW toward Bree. Bree-hill is hidden in the “curtain of rain.”
Continue uphill along road next to the heart of the Chetwood.
Pass spot where Strider had led them north from the road.
Reach the South-gate of Bree: Locked. Have to call many times.
Bree – Arrive at The Prancing Pony. Talk with Butterbur. Sam learns ‘Bill the Pony’ has returned. Stay at the Inn.
Leave Bree very early. Still raining. Bree-folk see them off.

Gandalf turns south to visit Tom Bombadil. Ride on as fast as possible.
Note: This is at the same place Tom had brought the hobbits back to the Road.
The Old Forest begins to the south, but is hidden in the rain.
Hobbits continue on at a fast pace. Forest is now quite close, but still hidden in the rain.
Sunset makes the ride even darker.
Reach the Brandywine Bridge late in the evening. Gates bar the way. When refused entry, Merry and Pippin climb the gate. Confront Bill Ferny. Spend the night in the Bridge-house with Shirriffs.
Decide to go straight to Hobbiton. Go west on the Road. Grey, but calm.
See smoke rising several places, especially in Woody End to the south.
Frogmorton: Shirriffs ‘arrest’ Frodo and friends. Stay at Shirriff-house.
10:00 a.m. Leave for Bywater. Merry makes Shirriffs march in front.
Noon. Rest.
Three-Farthing Stone (ca. 3 p.m.). Frodo and friends leave Shirriffs behind.
Turn NW on Bywater Road. High banks with hedges rise on each side.

Reach Bywater in late afternoon. All houses shut. Meet ruffians at west end of town. When confronted by Merry, Pippin and Sam, ruffians run. Merry blows the horn of Rohan, rallies hobbits. Pippin heads to Tookland to gather support. Merry sets trap: first Battle of Bywater. Frodo, Sam and Merry spend night with Farmer Cotton.
28 miles – Ride with Pippin to/from Tookland.

Ride with Merry, Sam and Frodo to/from Bywater to battle.
Second Battle of Bywater – on road south of town.
Eat late lunch at Cottons, then leave for Hobbiton.
Go west along Hobbiton Road. All trees felled along the road.
Reach bridge. Turn north across the Water. Much destroyed in Hobbiton. Can see the Hill ahead. Party Tree has been cut down.

Reach Bag End with a large party of hobbits. Frodo confronts Saruman. Wormtongue slays Saruman, and is killed by hobbits. 
End of the War of the Ring.

name: Bag End to the Grey Havens
description: Sam goes to the Grey Havens, then home again.

legs.comment: Sam and Frodo leave Bag End during the morning: Frodo on his pony, Strider, and Sam on Bill. They go south on the lane into Hobbiton. Cross the bridge over The Water and turn west.
Follow lane west along The Water.
Come to the plank bridge over The Water: the way they had taken from Bag End during the Quest. Retracing their journey, they go south along a path.
Cross the Great East Road from the Brandywine Bridge. Enter Tookland.
Hobbiton can still be seen from first slopes of the Green Hill Country.
Hobbiton is hidden as slopes rise and fall.
Ride by a birch wood.
Reach Stock Road
Ride through a deeply cloven track between tall trees.
Climb a steep slope.

Camp - In a firwood just over top of the hill. Sleep by a large tree.
Note: Same campsite as the one from the original journey.
They get water from the stream at the foot of the hill. “A little fall where the water fell a few feet over an outcrop of grey stone.”
Road rolls up and down.
Road zig-zigs to top of a steep bank and goes down for the last time. Can see across Woody End to the River. Continue on down the hill.
Road ahead runs fairly straight and level. Behind, it curves slightly. Sam points out the tree behind which Frodo had hidden from the Black Rider.

Stars are coming out as they reach the point where the road splits. The road to Stock bends left and goes down into the lowlands, while the path they took on their journey goes right, through ancient Oaks. Quite close to the road-meeting is the huge oak tree they had crept inside to eat. Standing beside it, they hear Elves singing: Galadriel, Celeborn, Elrond, and others appear on the valley road below, with Bilbo. Frodo and Sam join them.
The company takes the branching path a short distance, then turns southwest into the woods.
When they reach a woodland trail, they pass west through the woods, weaving through the Green-hill country. Continue all night.
Camp during the day (S. 23) at the south edge of the woods, still in the Green-hill country.
Continue west at dusk.
Pass south of Tuckburrow. Leave the hills and turn slightly more southwest.
Cross the road from Sarn Ford to Waymeet.
Pass now through open fields.
Camp in the open lands (day: S. 24).
Continue southwest across open land.
Land begins to climb west toward the White Downs.
Cross the road from Hardbottle.
Skirt south of the higher hills of the White Downs. Turn more to the west.
Beyond the Downs are grassy lowlands, almost uninhabited.
Camp (day: S. 25).
Curve now more north of west through grasslands.
Land slopes gently up toward the Far Downs.
Reach the crest of the Far Downs.
Zig-zag down the steep face of the Downs.
Reach the dry grasslands west of the Downs.
Can see the Tower Hills on the western horizon. Camp day and night (S. 26).
Ride now during the day, through uninhabited lands.
Land begins to rise toward the Tower Hills.
Camp not far south of the Great East Road.
Continue northwest toward the Great East Road.
Reach the Great East Road. Turn west.
Road climbs the lowest slopes of the Tower Hills.
Road reaches the Towers at the crest of the hills. To the west they can see the waters of the Gulf of Lune. Continue downhill.
Camp just at the western feet of the Tower Hills.
Ride west on the Road toward the Grey Havens.
Land drops gently down toward the Gulf.
Land drops more rapidly and the waters are clearly visible to the horizon.
Begin to see towers of the Havens on both sides of the firth of Lune.
Reach the Gates of the south Haven. Are greeted by Círdan the Shipwright.

Reach the shore. See Gandalf and Shadowfax awaiting them. Merry and Pippin arrive as the party is boarding the White Ship. Frodo says farewell.       End of the Fellowship of the Ring. The ship sails Into the West.
Sam, Merry and Pippin watch the ship as it passes out of sight, and remain watching far into the night.
At last they turn east and leave the Havens.
Go a short way on the Road and camp.
After breakfast, the hobbits ride east along the Road. Land rises steeply.
Slope becomes more gentle, but still climbs. Can see the top of the Towers ahead on the Tower Hills.
Camp at the feet of the Tower Hills (same site as the western journey).
Road climbs the western slope of the Tower Hills.
Reach the Towers on the crest of the Hills. Turn back for a last look west at the sea. Start down the eastern slope.
Reach the foot of the Hills. Continue east on the Road. Road falls gently.
Camp in grassland next to the Road.
Continue through grassy plain. See no one.
Ahead to the east, they can see the crest of the Far Downs.
Camp just off the Road. Weather pleasant.
Ride out early. Road curves east-northeast.
Reach the steep western face of the Far Downs. The Road climbs through a long cutting with steep, rocky walls on each side.
Road reaches the eastern end of the cutting. Now slopes gently down.
Downlands gradually flow into the grassy lowlands to the east.
Camp next to the Road.
Early morning: continue east-northeast on road.
Begin to see grazing lands.
Reach the steep western face of the White Downs.
Road rises sharply, cutting between chalky rock walls.
Reach Michel Delving. Stay at an Inn.
Leave after an early breakfast.
Descend gentle east-running backslope. Can see many grazing lands and some cultivated fields in lowlands below.
Reach the valleybottom east of the Downs. Road passes now through more settled area.
Come to Waymeet. Stay at an Inn.
Leave after a leisurely breakfast.
To the south they can see the wooded hills of Tookland.
Pass the pathway Sam and Frodo had taken south.
Come to Bywater Road. Sam says farewell to Merry and Pippin. They continue east on the Road, singing as they go. Sam turns northwest on Bywater Road.
Sam reaches Bywater and turns west toward Hobbiton.
Sam comes to Hobbiton. Goes north over the bridge across the Water and climbs up the Hill.
Sam arrives at Bag End at sunset: Home.

legs.day_full:
11 miles
10:30 a.m. Gandalf finds Bilbo having Second Breakfast. Sends him off.
legs.comment: Bilbo leaves Bag End and runs south down the lane toward Hobbiton.

legs.day_full:
11 miles
10:30 a.m. Gandalf finds Bilbo having Second Breakfast. Sends him off.
legs.comment: Crosses bridge across the Water. Turns east on the road to Bywater.

legs.day_full:
11 miles
10:30 a.m. Gandalf finds Bilbo having Second Breakfast. Sends him off.
legs.comment: Reaches The Green Dragon in Bywater by 11 a.m. [Note: an impossible feat, as he would have had to run 2 minute miles!]. The dwarves have a pony ready and they leave almost immediately. Gandalf soon joins them. Turn SE on Bywater Road. High banks with hedges rise on each side.

legs.day_full:
11 miles
10:30 a.m. Gandalf finds Bilbo having Second Breakfast. Sends him off.
legs.comment: Reach the Great East Road. Turn east.

legs.day_full:
11 miles
10:30 a.m. Gandalf finds Bilbo having Second Breakfast. Sends him off.
legs.comment: Pass Three-Farthing Stone.

legs.day_full:
11 miles
10:30 a.m. Gandalf finds Bilbo having Second Breakfast. Sends him off.
legs.comment: Camp.
Continue east on the Road at a leisurely pace.
Frogmorton. Stay at The Floating Log.
Continue east on the Road at a leisurely pace.
See the trees of Woody End across the fields to the south. Camp.
Continue east on the Road at a leisurely pace.
Reach the Brandywine Bridge. Stay at the Bridge Inn.
Cross the Bridge. Road to Buckland goes south. Pass the High Hay.
Stop for the night.
Continue east on the Road. The Old Forest appears south off the Road.
The Old Forest is now quite close.
Camp next to the Road.
Continue east on the road. Land is sparsely settled.
To the south the Old Forest ends.
Camp.
Continue east at a leisurely pace. The most western slopes of the Barrow-downs appear far to the south.
Barrow-downs continue. Between the Road and the Downs is a hedge.
Reach Bree. Stay at The Prancing Pony. Spend a late evening.
Stay at the inn much of the morning. Then skirt Bree-hill and turn east.
Reach the South-gate of Bree. Leave village and ride east on the road.
Camp next to a trail leading north into the Chetwood on Bree-hill.
Ride east at a leisurely pace. Road runs ESE skirting the Chetwood.
Continue downhill along road next to the heart of the Chetwood.
Stay at The Forsaken Inn: the last inn along the Great East Road.
Leave a bit earlier. Ride southeast along the Road at a comfortable pace.
Reach the east edge of the Chetwood. Scattered farms to the south.
Begin to see the Midgewater Marshes off to the northeast.
Camp.
Road continues east-southeast.
Road runs gently downhill.
Due north lie the western edge of the Midgewater Marshes.
Road continues east-southeast.
Meet a traveller who hurries by.
Camp. Marshes to the north are now closer to the road.
Continue east-southeast at a comfortable pace. Weather nice.
Road curves more to the east. Marshes fill all the northern horizon.
Camp due south of the Midgewater Marshes.
Continue east at a comfortable pace.
Road continues east around southern edge of the Marshes.
Camp south of the road, away from the Marshes.
Continue east on the Road.
Road now turns slightly more to the north.
Reach the southeast tip of the Midgewater Marshes. Camp.
Road turns more to the northeast. Slowly begins to climb uphill.
Weathertop is visible ahead, with the Weather Hills to its north.
Camp. Open, rough lands on both sides of the road. Weather pleasant.
Continue northeast on the Road at a comfortable pace.
Land now slopes slowly uphill toward Weathertop.
Weathertop rises more clearly ahead. Camp.
Road continues northeast, rising slowly.
Weathertop looms ahead and fills all the view.
Weathertop rises immediately north of the Road. Camp at its foot.
Road continues northeast past Weathertop.
Road reaches southeastern foot of Weathertop.
Come to the last foothill below Weathertop. Camp at its foot.
Continue northeast on road, dropping slowly into the ‘Lone-lands’. Road worsens.
South of the road are more rugged areas, covered with thickets.
Camp. Weather still is warm and clear.
Road still runs northeast. Weathertop is still visible straight behind.
Camp.
Road deteriorates still more. Weathertop now appears lower. Camp.
Road turns more east. Weathertop is no longer straight behind.
Continue east. Camp. Weather Hills still visible on the western horizon.
Continue east on the Road. Camp.
Continue east. Far behind, the Weather Hills show less and less. Ahead, company begins to see the tops of the Trollshaws. Camp.
Continue east. Road is rough. Camp.
Continue east. Behind, Weather Hills have almost disappeared. Ahead, dark wooded hills appear higher. Camp.
Open country. No streams. Camp.
Road curves more to southeast. South of the road are bushes and stunted trees: wild and pathless. Camp north of the road.
Weather pleasant. Ahead, Trollshaws show clearly. Camp.
Road swings southeast through open country. Ahead on hills of the Trollshaws, can now see “old castles with an evil look.” Camp.
Continue southeast on road. Weather turns cold and wet.
Reach northeast end of a valley south of the road. Continue on. Road now is only a muddy track.

Nearly dark: cross The Last Bridge. Stop to camp in clump of trees. Realize Gandalf is missing. Pony bolts into river and loses baggage with food. See fire in trees on hillside to east. Decide to investigate.

No path through trees to fire. Reach fire: Trolls. Company captured.
(Note: This location is the most difficult of the entire journey to reconcile with LOTR. While logically, the Company probably went a mile or two at most, this does not work at all with the LOTR pathways. Even at a minimum, it should be at least 7 miles from the bridge to the Trolls. See detailed discussion and maps in The Atlas).
Gandalf keeps trolls arguing until dawn. Sun turns them to stone.
– Gandalf and company follow trail to Troll-hole. Find swords for Thorin and Gandalf. Bilbo takes blade. Collect gold. Return to fire.
Continue down path and reach the Road. Bury gold and continue east.
Road now turns southeast. Skirts hills of the Trollshaws.
Camp.
Leave early and make haste.
Enter woods. Continue east on road through woods.
Woods run into the valley on north.
Pass out-thrust ‘toe’ of a hill.
Camp near valley from the north.
Road now runs due east. With few provisions, they hurry along.
Can see ruins on hilltop to the north.
South of the Road, ravine of the Bruinen comes close. Road turns NE.
Pass a valley from the north.
Camp.
Continue northeast. Road still hugs feet of the Trollshaws.
Cross a small stream. Road bends more northeast. The steep ravine of the Bruinen also runs east-northeast not far to the south.
Continue east-northeast along road . Ride very quickly.
Road runs gently downhill. Much grass on sides. Hills still on the north.
Road drops through a cutting of red stone topped with tall pines, then crosses a long flat mile toward the river.
Reach the Ford of Bruinen. Can see Misty Mountains clearly. Camp.
Cross the Ford of Bruinen.
Gandalf searches out the path. Must go carefully.
Path runs next to a steep gully on the left.
On the east, a deep ravine holds a waterfall.
Come to the sudden cliff into the valley of Rivendell. Ride slowly down the zig-zag path. Pines cling to the upper slopes, beech and oak below.
Lead the ponies across the narrow bridge over the upper Bruinen. Reach the ‘Last Homely House’ in Rivendell.

name: Rivendell to the Lonely Mountain
description: The company continues to the Lonely Mountain.

legs.comment: Leave Rivendell, camp in foothills - Ponies.
Still in foothills - Ponies.
Climbing steadily - Ponies. 4 miles per day
Tremendous Thunder-battle in afternoon. Shelter in a cave. Goblins capture them.
Thorin questioned in Great Goblin’s Cavern. Gandalf rescues them.
Company pauses. Gandalf makes light. Dwarves carry Bilbo.
Gandalf and Thorin fight off Goblins.
Goblins Attack.
End of Goblin attack. In rush, Bilbo accidentally left behind.
Dwarves reach Lower Goblin-gate (‘Back Door’).
Bilbo wakes in the dark and realizes he is alone. Begins crawling along.
Bilbo, while crawling, finds the ONE RING. Pulling out his sword for light, he begins trotting along passage.
Bilbo unknowingly passes passage to ‘Back Door’
Bilbo reaches Gollum’s Lake. Riddle Contest.
Bilbo follows Gollum back up passage. Side passages begin to appear.
Gollum blocks entrance to tunnel to Back Door. Bilbo jumps over him.
Bilbo reaches the ‘Back Door’ and escapes.
Goblins follow Bilbo a short distance into the upland valley.
Bilbo leaves upland valley on trail with cliff on left, drop-off on right.
Bilbo finds Dwarves and Gandalf in dell below trail. They continue on.
Cross a stream (based on atlas map).
Trail leads to top of a landslide. They slip sideways in the stones.
Reach the bottom of the landslide and go east. Pine forest (ca. 7 p.m.).
Clearing. Hear wolves. Climb trees. WARG ATTACK. Eagles Rescue.
Eagles take Company to their Eyrie. Sleep there.
Eagles fly Company to The Carrock.
Company reaches Beorn’s house.
Leave Beorn’s in early afternoon (on ponies). Ride north.
Camp.
Ride through grasslands west of Mirkwood.
Bright, fair, chill fall-like mist. Bilbo sees Beorn. Press on under moon.
Start before dawn. Land slopes up as they near the forest. Reach trees in afternoon. Camp.
Gandalf warns Company not to leave the trail. Gandalf departs and takes ponies back to Beorn. Company takes Forest Trail.
First camp.
On Forest Trail in Mirkwood.
After 143 miles on Forest Trail, reach the Enchanted River. Cross by boat. Bombur falls in water and immediately falls asleep and must be carried.
Camp.
On Forest Trail.
On Forest Trail.
Walk through open beech-woods much of the day.
Bilbo climbs a tree (in an oak-wood), but can see nothing as it is in bottom of a bowl.
Camp. Eat last of food at supper.
Bombur awakes in morning. Rains all day. No food.
About to camp when see a fire. LEAVE PATH.
Reach first Elves’ fire. Lights put out. Frantically search for each other.
Reach second Elves’ fire. Lights put out again. Stay huddled together.
Predawn – See third Elves’ fire.
Lights put out. Thorin captured by Elves. Dwarves scatter and are captured by spiders. Bilbo left alone. Kills spider. Swoons. Wakes during the morning and names his sword: Sting.
Bilbo finds dwarves cocooned and rescues them.
Bilbo draws spiders away. Dwarves almost recaptured. Bilbo returns.
After more fighting against spiders, spiders give up. Camp there.
Struggle on all day. Dwarves surrender when surrounded by Elves. Bilbo uses ring and disappears.
Dwarves imprisoned in Elvenking Thranduil’s Caverns. Bilbo follows.
Bilbo searches out each Dwarf’s cell.
Bilbo finds Thorin’s cell.
Bilbo ponders escape plan. Learns about barrels in cellars: Sept. 20.
Escape in barrels in afternoon. Float down the Forest River.
Leave trees of Mirkwood.
Dusk - Reach huts of the Raft-elves. Dwarves still in barrels. Bilbo huddles nearby wearing Ring.
Bilbo’s 50th Birthday. Wood-elves tie barrels into raft. Bilbo rides (invisible).
Reach marshy area. Bilbo sees the Lonely Mountain.
End of the marshes. River rushes along.
Reach Lake-town after sunset. Bilbo frees dwarves. They enter the town.
Leave Lake-town in three boats.
Camp at the mouth of the River Running.
Row upstream against current. Camp.
Third day in boats. Camp on west shore. Met there by ponies and supplies.
Head northwest on ponies.
Reach the Desolation of the Dragon.
1st Camp - West of the south tip of the west spur of Lonely Mountain.
Bilbo, Fili, Kili and Balin scout to River Running and go part way toward the Front Gate.
Move to 2nd camp – In narrower valley due west of the mountain.
Bilbo, Fili and Kili find the Hidden Door on Oct. 18.
Move to upland bay by Hidden Door = 3rd Camp.
Try to open the Hidden Door.
Open door at sunset.
Bilbo descends to Smaug’s Cellar, steals cup, returns. Smaug searches ANGRILY.
Bilbo returns to Smaug’s Cellar. Riddles.
After Bilbo returns, company moves into passage. Smaug smashes mountainside, then attacks Lake-town. Bard kills Smaug.
Company goes to Smaug’s Cellar. Bilbo finds Arkenstone. Dwarves search hoard.
Go through Chamber of Thror.
Leave via Front Gate of the mountain.
Ford stream at the fallen bridge. Take the road into the valley of Dale.
Take a hill path from the road onto the western spur of the mountain.
Path reaches steep drop-off.
Path ends at Guard-post. 4th Camp.
They learn of Smaug’s death and return to Front Gate. Fortify entrance.
Bilbo goes to Bard’s camp and gives him the Arkenstone. Returns to the gate of the Lonely Mountain.
